name: 應用行為分析
goals: Understand theoretical and applied information regarding ABA.
Demonstrate skills in the use of ABA principles in the design and implementation of individual behavior intervention plan.
Illustrate the relationship between family members, schools, and communities to influence effective ABA-based practice for individuals with special needs.
Summarize and critique the literature in the field of ABA.
syllabus:
**Week**

**Topics**

1

Introduction of the Course and the Requirements  
Introduction to ABA

2

Introduction to Academic Writing Tutoring (Center for Academic Literacy, NTNU)  
Experimental Design; Behavioral Observation and Graphing

3

Identifying and Defining Behavior  
Measuring Behavior  
    Functional Behavior Assessment  
Evaluating and Analyzing Behavior Change

4

Strategies to Increase Behaviors:  
    Reinforcement  
    Preference and Reinforcer Assessment  
    Token Economies  
    Group Contingencies

5

Strategies to Decrease Behaviors:  
    Punishment  
    Extinction  
    Differential Reinforcement  
    Antecedent Interventions

6

Antecedent Control:  
    Establishing Operations  
    Motivating Operations  
    Stimulus Control  
Stimulus Control:  
    Discrimination Training  
    Imitation, Modeling, Prompting & Fading  
    Chaining  
    Shaping

7

Evidence-Based Practice of ABA across Settings

8

Behaviorally-Based Intervention

9

Naturalistic Behavioral Approaches

10

Self-Management

11

Generalization and Maintenance

12

Verbal Behavior

13

Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports (PBIS)

14

Clinical and Organizational Applications of ABA

15

Ethical Issues and Considerations in ABA

16

Finish up & Review

grading.note: Students will be given points for active participation and guided reading in class discussion that is relevant to the topic discussed.
Presentation: Students will be required to conduct a presentation to report their paper.
Paper: Student will choose an ABA concept covered in the class that they would like to explore further and complete a final paper.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
